item.description:
PROFILE

Kazumasa KANEKO was born in 1992. He is currently a Master’s student in theoretical biology at The University of Tokyo Graduate School of Engineering. His main interest is a structure of complex systems; life and society.

SKILLS / PROFICIENCY

  • dynamical systems
  • machine learning
  • software development (PHP, openFrameworks, iOS)
  • generative design

EDUCATION

2015- M.Eng., Department of Electrical Engineering and Information Systems, Graduate Shool of Engineering, The University of Tokyo, Japan
2011-2015 B.Eng., Department of Information and Communication Engineering, Faculty of Engineering, The University of Tokyo, Japan

WORK/VOLUNTEER EXPERIENCE

08 / 2012 - 09 / 2012    Volunteering at a local NGO in Uganda
12 / 2012 - 06 / 2013    Organizing a TEDx event
08 / 2013 - 09 / 2013    Internship on machine learning at KOZO KEIKAKU ENGINEERING Inc.
05 / 2014 - 05/2016    Web programmer(part-time) at digitiminimi Inc.

CONTACT

kkaneko11 [at] gmail.com

item.title: RESEACH
item.description:
CURRENT PROJECT -Population dynamics on immune cell development-

T cell, one of immune cells, gets matured step by step from immature cells in thymus. In this maturation process, only T cells which recognize antigens such as bacterium and don’t recognize cell from self by mistake, can proliferate and get matured through an interaction with thymic epithelial cells(TECs) and thus T cells which only attack enemy are selected. We are developing a mathematical model of the T cell development.

PUBLICATIONS

INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCES

  1. Kazumasa Kaneko, Ryo Yokota, Taishin Akiyama, Tetsuya J. Kobayashi : Modeling and inferring dynamics of T cell population in thymus, JSMB 2016, Sep. 2016.

    DOMESTIC CONFERENCES & WORKSHOPS

  2. 金子和正, 横田亮, 秋山泰身, 小林徹也 : 免疫細胞の分化プロセスの力学系によるモデリング, 生命情報科学若手の会 第8回研究会, Oct. 2016.
